name: Gl 686
scenarioDescription:
The Gl 686 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Gl 686 is a star with 0.42 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.42 times its radius. It is located 26.61 light years away from the solar system.

Gl 686 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Gl 686 system


Gl 686 b

Gl 686 b was discovered by the Roque de los Muchachos Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Gl 686 b is 6.64302 times the mass of Earth. At 6.64302 Earth masses, Gl 686 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Gl 686, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Roque de los Muchachos Observatory.
